## RR2 Mask Products Overview

- RR2 v1.4 supplies effective coverage, visibility, and shear-weight products that we will keep sampling as the RR2→DR1 handoff solidifies (docs/rr2_catalog_README.md:19).

## Effective Coverage Mask

- DpdHealpixEffectiveCoverageVMPZ captures the RR2 3×2pt footprint and depth variations at NSIDE 16384; here we downsample it for quick cross-correlation QA (docs/rr2_catalog_README.md:20).

![](images/euclidwl_coverage_mask.png){width=90%}

## Combined W Mask

- Following the RR2 guidance `W = coverage × (1 + visibility)` to fold SOM systematic templates into the footprint before correlations (docs/rr2_catalog_README.md:73).

![](images/euclidwl_W_mask.png){width=90%}

## Source Counts (Unweighted)

- Simple RR2 shear-source counts per pixel from `RR2Coverage.bin_map`, a first look at raw sky density trends ahead of weights or systematics (code/dr1_cmbx/.../explore_masks.py:41).

![](images/euclidwl_unweighted_counts.png){width=90%}

## Source Counts (Weighted)

- Applying `she_lensmc_weight` to build an effective number-density map, highlighting how the catalog weights reshape the usable sky (docs/rr2_catalog_README.md:138).

![](images/euclidwl_weighted_counts.png){width=90%}
